New Records: Alperen Şengün recorded a double-double with 26 points, 10 rebounds, six assists, and two steals; Jalen Green scored a game-high 29 points, including 22 in the third quarter; Amen Thompson contributed 20 points and 15 rebounds; Fred VanVleet had 19 points and 12 assists
Key Match Events: The Rockets trailed 28-16 after a slow first quarter but rebounded with a 10-0 run in the second quarter; Jalen Green's buzzer-beater gave the Rockets a 57-55 halftime lead; The Rockets scored 40 points in the third quarter, fueled by Alperen Şengün and Jalen Green; Houston converted 35 points from Washington's 18 turnovers
Pre-Game Insights: The Wizards were struggling with a 6-28 record before the game; Corey Kispert and Jonas Valanciunas provided early offense for Washington; The Rockets were looking to extend their 24-win streak
Post-Match Reflections: The Rockets' offensive depth was too much for the Wizards to handle; Washington's defense struggled to contain Houston's players; The game extended the Rockets' winning streak and solidified their position in the Western Conference
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Capital One Arena; The Rockets improved to 24 wins; The Wizards' injury to Kyle Kuzma further impacted their chances
Others: The Rockets and Wizards are key teams in the Eastern Conference; The game was part of the 2025 NBA season
